page.title: 05Saving Turf
page.content: The turf is left to dry for two or three weeks depending on the weather. The turf is turned so that the other side may dry.Whilst doing this the turf breaks into small lengths.If the weather is good they are bagged and taken home.If they are not completely dried out they are built into stacks called clamps.This gives them a chance to dry out properly. After that they are brought home with a tractor and trailer.They are emptied out and stored in a large open shed.They are burned just like coal.
